subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: ... Personally, I always just put a comment in there - but I d have no trouble using assertTrue(true) if it helped a tool in the fight against empty catches.
messageBody:
haefeleuser wrote:

>What do you prefer in the case above: assertTrue(true) or inline
>comment in the catch block?
>
>
Personally, I always just put a comment in there - but I'd have no
trouble using assertTrue(true) if it helped a tool in the fight against
empty catches.

>try
>{
> articleProvider.findArticleById("foobar");
>}
>catch(NoObjectFoundException e)
>{
> // Its okay since we expect it.
>}
>
>
Don't you also need a fail("no exception thrown") inside the try after
the call to findArticleById? Otherwise, if no exception is thrown, this
test still passes.
